parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to official electoral campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to Manolache Vasile, a senatorial candidate.  The phrase "Manolache Vasile - Senator" is used in the post's metadata and hashtags. This directly identifies a candidate participating in the elections.  Therefore, Article 36 (7) - a applies.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The targeting parameters (age, gender, location) further confirm its intention to address a broad segment of the population. Therefore, it addresses the wide population.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's core message encourages voters to support Manolache Vasile. Phrases like "SchimbarePentruOameni" (Change for People), "VotulContează" (The Vote Matters), and "RomâniaMaiBună" (A Better Romania) explicitly aim to influence voting behavior in favor of the candidate. The call to action ("Send message") also suggests an attempt to engage voters directly.  Therefore, Article 36 (7) - c applies.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic content. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific candidate and their platform, lacking the neutrality expected from journalistic work.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted promotional message designed to sway voters. The positive portrayal of the candidate and the call to action clearly indicate an intention beyond personal expression.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1075210477421694</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, promotes Manolache Vasile, a senatorial candidate.  The post uses positive language, appeals to voters' desire for change, and includes a call to action.  While it doesn't explicitly instruct voters to vote for him at the polling station, its clear objective is to positively influence voters' opinions and encourage them to support Manolache Vasile. The targeting parameters show a clear attempt to reach a wide audience.  The post fulfills all criteria of Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, thus qualifying as electoral propaganda.  The fact that the post was published after the official campaign period ended (according to the provided end_date) is a further violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Manolache Vasile</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>MOMENTUM</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1075210477421694) cu scop electoral, care promovează candidatul la Senat Manolache Vasile, folosind mesaje pozitive și un apel la acțiune ("Send message"), având un efect electoral clar de influențare a votului în favoarea acestuia. Postarea, cu o cheltuială de sub 100 RON, a atins între 1000 și 2000 de impresii și o estimare a audienței de 100.000-500.000 de persoane, conform datelor din Ad Library.  Conținutul postării, inclusiv hashtag-urile "#ManolacheVasileSenator #SchimbarePentruOameni #VotulContează #RomâniaMaiBună", demonstrează clar intenția de a influența votul, încălcând prevederile legale privind continuarea propagandei electorale după încheierea perioadei legale.  Informațiile de contact ale Momentum Motion Pictures SRL sunt disponibile în Ad Library: contact@momentum.com.ro și +40767277777.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
